resources.string: Bhojtal attracts tourists due to its scenic beauty. The National Sailing School was established at the Boat Club on its eastern side. This club offers various water sports such as kayaking, canoeing, rafting, water skiing, parasailing etc. A number of operators provide facilities for exciting trips by sail, paddle and motor boats.
Every year, on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri, a big fair is organized at Bhojpur.
Local events organised by Tour Guides

Van Vihar National Park, situated on the south-eastern side of the lake, attracts tourists. The road passing through it has on one side the animals in their natural habitats, and on the other hand is the scenic beauty of the lake.
Bhojeśvar or Bhojasvāmin temple, Quarries and rock drawings, Jain temples, Main Temple & Idol

Of the numerous shelters, the Auditorium cave is one of the significant features of the site. Surrounded by quartzite towers which are visible from several kilometers distance, the Auditorium rock is the largest shelter at Bhimbetka.

Sanchi Stupa is a Buddhist complex, famous for its Great Stupa, on a hilltop at Sanchi Town in Raisen District of the State of Madhya Pradesh, India. It is located in 46 kilometres (29 mi) north-east of Bhopal, capital of Madhya Pradesh.
Wind and Waves - Lake Driver Road, Van Vihar Road, Shymla Hills, TT Nagar, Bhopal
The Highway Treat restaurant is located at the entrance of Rock shelters of Bhimbetka on the Bhopal Hoshangabad stretch of the National Highway.
